00078 #ifndef OPENSSL_NO_ERR
00079 #define ERR_PUT_error(a,b,c,d,e)    ERR_put_error(a,b,c,d,e)
00080 #else
00081 #define ERR_PUT_error(a,b,c,d,e)    ERR_put_error(a,b,c,NULL,0)
00082 #endif

00084 #include <errno.h>
00085 
00086 #define ERR_TXT_MALLOCED    0x01
00087 #define ERR_TXT_STRING      0x02
00088 
00089 #define ERR_NUM_ERRORS  16
00090 typedef struct err_state_st
00091     {
00092     unsigned long pid;
00093     unsigned long err_buffer[ERR_NUM_ERRORS];
00094     char *err_data[ERR_NUM_ERRORS];
00095     int err_data_flags[ERR_NUM_ERRORS];
00096     const char *err_file[ERR_NUM_ERRORS];
00097     int err_line[ERR_NUM_ERRORS];
00098     int top,bottom;
00099     } ERR_STATE;

00163 /* Borland C seems too stupid to be able to shift and do longs in
00164  * the pre-processor :-( */
00165 #define ERR_PACK(l,f,r)     (((((unsigned long)l)&0xffL)*0x1000000)| \
00166                 ((((unsigned long)f)&0xfffL)*0x1000)| \
00167                 ((((unsigned long)r)&0xfffL)))
00168 #define ERR_GET_LIB(l)      (int)((((unsigned long)l)>>24L)&0xffL)
00169 #define ERR_GET_FUNC(l)     (int)((((unsigned long)l)>>12L)&0xfffL)
00170 #define ERR_GET_REASON(l)   (int)((l)&0xfffL)
00171 #define ERR_FATAL_ERROR(l)  (int)((l)&ERR_R_FATAL)
00172

00179 #define SYS_F_IOCTLSOCKET   5
00180 #define SYS_F_BIND      6
00181 #define SYS_F_LISTEN        7
00182 #define SYS_F_ACCEPT        8

00184 #define SYS_F_OPENDIR       10
00185 #define SYS_F_FREAD     11

00192 #define ERR_R_DH_LIB    ERR_LIB_DH        /* 5 */
00193 #define ERR_R_EVP_LIB   ERR_LIB_EVP       /* 6 */

00196 #define ERR_R_PEM_LIB   ERR_LIB_PEM       /* 9 */
00197 #define ERR_R_DSA_LIB   ERR_LIB_DSA      /* 10 */

00215 #define ERR_R_NESTED_ASN1_ERROR         58
00216 #define ERR_R_BAD_ASN1_OBJECT_HEADER        59
00217 #define ERR_R_BAD_GET_ASN1_OBJECT_CALL      60
00218 #define ERR_R_EXPECTING_AN_ASN1_SEQUENCE    61
00219 #define ERR_R_ASN1_LENGTH_MISMATCH      62
00220 #define ERR_R_MISSING_ASN1_EOS          63
00221 
00222 /* fatal error */
00223 #define ERR_R_FATAL             64
00224 #define ERR_R_MALLOC_FAILURE            (1|ERR_R_FATAL)
00225 #define ERR_R_SHOULD_NOT_HAVE_BEEN_CALLED   (2|ERR_R_FATAL)
00226 #define ERR_R_PASSED_NULL_PARAMETER     (3|ERR_R_FATAL)
00227 #define ERR_R_INTERNAL_ERROR            (4|ERR_R_FATAL)
00228 
00229 /* 99 is the maximum possible ERR_R_... code, higher values
00230  * are reserved for the individual libraries */

00233 typedef struct ERR_string_data_st
00234     {
00235     unsigned long error;
00236     const char *string;
00237     } ERR_STRING_DATA;

00286 /* This opaque type encapsulates the low-level error-state functions */
00287 typedef struct st_ERR_FNS ERR_FNS;
00288 /* An application can use this function and provide the return value to loaded
00289  * modules that should use the application's ERR state/functionality */
00290 const ERR_FNS *ERR_get_implementation(void);
00291 /* A loaded module should call this function prior to any ERR operations using
00292  * the application's "ERR_FNS". */
00293 int ERR_set_implementation(const ERR_FNS *fns);
